medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortness of breath and abdominal pain in a patient taking rosiglitazone.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began within 1 week of starting rosiglitazone therapy, including nausea, anorexia, fatigue, and abdominal pain. Symptoms progressed, leading to hospitalization after rosiglitazone was discontinued 5 days prior to admission. One day before admission, he experienced shortness of breath.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of atrial fibrillation, hypertension, coronary artery disease, and New York Heart Association class II congestive heart failure. He had undergone coronary artery bypass surgery 10 years prior, and type 2 diabetes mellitus was diagnosed approximately 1 month before admission.
medical_history.social_history: The patient reported drinking two cans of beer daily. He had no history of exposure to hepatotoxins.
